material.mattext: What proportion of students score between 400 and 600 on the SAT-M? In other words, find P(400 < X < 600).

We need to find P(400 < X < 600), where X is a normal random variable with mean 507 and standard deviation of 111. The z-score of 400 is (400 − 507)/111 = −0.96 (rounded) The z-score of 600 is (600 − 507)/111 = 0.84 (rounded), and therefore, P(400 < X < 600) = P(-0.96 < Z < 0.84) = P(Z < 0.84)-P(Z< −0.96) = (table) 0.7995 − 0.1685 = 0.6310. We conclude that roughly 63.1% of the student score between 400 and 600.
